intro: Galium stojanovii, commonly known as Stojanov's bedstraw, is a perennial herb native to the mountainous regions of Southeast Europe. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its slender, creeping stems and opposite, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, white to pinkish flowers in clusters, typically blooming from late spring to early summer. It thrives in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Galium stojanovii is often found in alpine and subalpine habitats, where it contributes to the biodiversity of these ecosystems.
